message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet at the end date, the total liabilities are the “Total Current Liabilities” which is 3,428,090.41.
• The total assets at the end date are 15,086,049.65.
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 3,428,090.41 / 15,086,049.65 ≈ 0.2273. When rounded to two decimal places, that is 0.23.

Step 2. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is –4,900,875.61.
• From the income statement, the Net Profit is –1,342,040.76.
• Since both values are negative, the ratio will be positive.
• Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = (-4,900,875.61) / (-1,342,040.76) ≈ 3.65.

Thus, the final answer in the requested JSON format is:
{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.23",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "3.65"
  }
}
